-MoPe.definition: In computer programming, asynchronous operation means that a process operates independently of other processes, whereas synchronous operation means that the process runs only as a result of some other process being completed or handed off.
-MoPe.title: Asynchronous Programming

-PoPe.definition: A Promise is a proxy for a value not necessarily known when the promise is created. It allows you to associate handlers with an asynchronous action's eventual success value or failure reason.
-PoPe.title: Promises

-CoPe.definition: The single-responsibility principle (SRP) is a computer-programming principle that states that every module, class or function in a computer program should have responsibility over a single part of that program's functionality, and it should encapsulate that part.
-CoPe.title: Single Responsibility Principle

-LoPe.definition: The Document Object Model (DOM) is a programming interface for web documents. It represents the page so that programs can change the document structure, style, and content.
-LoPe.title: Document Object Model (DOM)

-ToPe.definition: An API (Application Programming Interface) is a set of features and rules that exist inside a software program (the application) enabling interaction with it through software - as opposed to a human user interface.
-ToPe.title: Application Programming Interface (API)
